title: Strategic Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at First Nations Health Authority
Interview Descriptions: Spoke to a HR recruiter first who asked questions about ability to work in Canada, COVID vaccination status, and earliest available start date, then moved to an interview with 3 panelists.
Interview Questions: What is your understanding of OCAP and how would you incorporate it into your interactions with the data of First Nations people?

title: Reporting Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at First Nations Health Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: It takes 3 month, but they are very nice. They asked about cultural safety and humility. And also asked a lot of questions about my work experience. They asked about Tableau, sql work experience as well.

title: Statistical Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at First Nations Health Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: During my interview, I was impressed by the friendly and understanding nature of the three individuals who conducted it. They asked me around ten questions over the course of an hour to gauge my suitability for the position.
Interview Questions: Questions about the candidate's experience in data management.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at First Nations Health Authority
Interview Descriptions: organized with panel of 3 to interview , they were very welcoming and straight forward . Professional and clear and thorough . Friendly and detail oriented and I could tell they had worked there for a long time and appreciated my background skills and what I knew about the company
Interview Questions: Lots of situational questions and getting to know my thought process

title: Human Resources Business Partner HRBP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at First Nations Health Authority (North Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a long process. Phone screen, interview, another interview before an offer. The communication was lacking and the questions were not relating as much to the role in my opinion.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about a time you had to communicate with a difficult manager.
Tell us about a time you had to initiate a change in the organization
Why did you apply for this role? Why FNHA
What does cultural safety mean to you

title: Co-Op Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at First Nations Health Authority (West Vancouver, BC) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Pretty basic affair, a couple of people interviewed me and asked me questions about my education, work experience and myself. I answered their questions, but they seemed to be vague on what I was supposed to be doing at FNHA.
Interview Questions: What was your work experience at your last co-op position?

title: Associate HRBP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at First Nations Health Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: 3 stages to the interview one telephone, one 1:1, and one panel interview.  It was a strong interview process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you managed a difficult situation.

title: Health Benefits Assessor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at First Nations Health Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: General questions about past work experience, and general interests. More focused questions about what wellness (FNHA's mandate) means to you. A question about how you would prioritize tasks (administrative last, urgent first)
Interview Questions: How would you handle conflict with a client

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at First Nations Health Authority
Interview Descriptions: I was approached by the hiring manager over the phone and scheduled a in person interview. They couldn’t be more friendly and told me a lot about the company. Really positive environment at the sinclair office.
Interview Questions: What do you know about FNHA?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at First Nations Health Authority
Interview Descriptions: They took about 2 weeks to contact me after submitting my application. First they scheduled a preliminary phone screening then an in person interview.  The backcheck company they use was very slow.
Interview Questions: Questions were standard interview questions.  Inquired about my previous experience,  capabilities, and STAR style prompts.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at First Nations Health Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied through agency.Had in Person Interview in their office , 2 member panel- with few technical questions.All straight forward questions with previous work experience and i answered well-But was wondering  with my rejection.
Interview Questions: DO you have experience on Excel,SQL?

title: RNC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at First Nations Health Authority in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Zoom Panel
30+ min
Game enough time to think through both clinical and behavioural based questions
All levels of team present
They are not clear on role and don’t provide your responsibilities but ensure they inform you after they hire you via various emails. Your responsibilities list are long and open so you interpret you need to take it on or run the risk of it not getting done but beware you will get feedback
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Events Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at First Nations Health Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
First was a pre-screen phone call to confirm resume points and they asked some additional questions. Next was an in person panel style interview with scripted questions. 

Everything seemed very scripted.

title: Policy Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at First Nations Health Authority
Interview Descriptions: This process took well over two months from the first interview to final in-person interview. It was a three step process with a skills assessment/assignment as the second step. The second step was quite time consuming and you will not receive any feedback. Communication with HR is terrible. You won't hear back for weeks and will have to try to track them down in-between each step. Following third interview, I was told I would hear 2 days later. 3 weeks later, I FINALLY got a hold of someone who said I didn't get the job and that they had hired internally instead. I didn't realise I was competing directly with internal applicants.
Interview Questions: Very standard interview questions, nothing difficult or tricky. Tell them about your experience, why are you good for the job etc.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at First Nations Health Authority (Vancouver, BC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Friendly process. Behavioral style of interview. You are provided a list of questions (about 20) sometime ahead of the interview which helps you prepare. All the questions are competency/ behavioral based. Very friendly interviewers.
Interview Questions:
Tell me a time when you had to manage a difficult client or team member.
Describe a time when you learned immensely.
Describe a time when you achieved a goal.
Why would you like to join us.
What type of managerial style do you prefer?
Why are you passionate about your role?

title: Finance Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at First Nations Health Authority (North Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Written assessment followed by an in person interview with hiring Managers, the interview process takes longer time than usual. It's NGO, but the hiring process is similar as government, be patient!
